newsitem.title: USA: COMEX copper called to open slightly lower.
newsitem.headline: COMEX copper called to open slightly lower.

text.p: COMEX copper futures were called to open slightly lower as London weakened earlier.
The LME cash-to-three-month backwardation narrowed further to $43/$45 from $48/$53 late Thursday as LME stocks rose another 5,325 tonnes to 210,225 tonnes, the highest level since March 3.

COMEX September copper was called down 0.30 to 0.40 cent after ending Thursday at 108 cents a lb. The LME official three-month price is $2,315/$2,316 a tonne, up $23/$24 from Thursday's evening evaluation.
